result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher Justin Provo-Gonzalez

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Christopher Justin Provo-Gonzalez in court.  Attorney Barry S. Cohen in court for Christopher Justin Provo-Gonzalez.  Prosecuting attorney James C Griffin in court for the State of Wisconsin. Scheduling conference held. Defense is requesting a plea and sentencing date in December. Case is adjourned in Branch 02.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 16, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Christopher Justin Provo-Gonzalez in court with attorney Barry S. Cohen.  Gerald Henry Alder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: STW
Case set for an Arraignment. Original Information received and e-filed.  Defense acknowledges receipt of the Information, waives reading and enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of defendant.  Defense counsel received discovery and offer and request case set for hearing. Upon motion of defense, Court ordered defendant to continue breathalyzers with Smart Start Wisconsin. Court orders case for adjourned, Branch 2.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Christopher Justin Provo-Gonzalez in court with Attorney Barry S. Cohen; both appear by video.  Edward OBrien appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Court took judicial notice of 12cf126. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer N. Petersen.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed. Defense requests an arraignment date.  Case is adjourned to Branch 02.  Arraignment scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Remaining cash bail posted to be returned to remitter. 
The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Christopher Justin Provo-Gonzalez in court with attorney Barry S. Cohen.  Grace M. Gall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 2.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.

  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
